value: conclusion of chapter eight when we
stepped into the auditorium expecting to
see the gleaming white walls beautiful
chandeliers and blue carpet we gasped
and shocked a thick darkness oily and
black filled the room the chandeliers
were dimmed a murky yellow and the blue
backlit cross at the rear of the
sanctuary seem to be shrouded in a cloud
of darkness later that day can describe
the room as if bands of thick darkness
streams of the auditorium I had never
seen this church look so dark in
retrospect I now realize that we had
finally seen this church on a Sabbath
day and it could no longer hide beneath
its sunday best veneer my wife's dream
at first a mystery started to resolve
with greater clarity as we strode down
the central aisle toward the pulpit the
pastor and his wife greeted us his eyes
look bloodshot and it was clear he had
not shaved in a week please take a seat
I think we would prefer to stand I said
very well he said smiling gently pastor
if you don't mind I'm just going to tape
record this conversation grant said as
he took out the device from his pocket
abomination abomination abomination he
suddenly yelled get out all of you get
out get out of here realizing the
situation was quickly escalating out of
control I turned to grant just put it
away grant we don't need it I turned
back to the pastor of my eyes pleading
with him pastor please I just want to
know what line i crossed what is going
on here you are an abomination causing
desolation on the altar Daniel on
abomination I glanced at Philip and we
exchanged what kind of drugs is this
pastor taking type of
you need to leave you all be believed
just leave right now a pastor pointed
his finger behind us toward the exit I
looked at the pastor right in the eye
realizing I was dealing with a devilish
force I'm very clearly said no as soon
as I uttered that word both the pastor
his wife began to hop up and down eyes
wide and frantic call the police call
the police we need to call the police I
shook my head disgust and turn toward
the exit this is ridiculous we're not
getting anywhere let's go guys as you
began to leave a delicate century the
pastor's wife rushed toward us wagging
her finger every Sunday you come in here
testifying about how you preach all
across the city making us feel bad for
not joining you all you do is fill us
with guilt guilt that's all you do I
stopped near the entrance of the church
shocked as the Pasha's wife continued to
launch a full tirade against us I
couldn't believe that all the times we
had honest a--the honestly and
innocently testified of how God had used
us in preaching she had taken it as us
guilty Mary none of it made any sense we
stepped out of the church onto the porch
and the bright sunlight starkly reminded
us of how dark it had been inside from a
door below the porch the lift in the
church basement in fellowship hall the
newcomer stuck his head out a wicked
grin on his face reaching the parking
lot Tim his red beard flying in the wind
turned his burly truck driver frame
toward the small church it had been Tim
who introduced us to this church almost
two years ago Ichabod Ichabod Ichabod he
declared pointing is fingered in the sky
the glory has departed this place as we
climbed into our cars I heard police
sirens began to wail all around us the
police had not been called by the pastor
or his wife there had been no time but
the spiritual realm disrupted by this
clash was manifesting in the physical
you will be beaten with many strikes the
pastor called out from the church by
your own words you will be condemned I
shouted back
as I looked through the windshield of my
car I will never forget the image that
has delicately printed itself into my
mind standing in the sparkling summer
the black pastor stood up a porch of his
whitewashed tomb of the church he smiled
his hands folded in front of him the Sun
was so bright his black skin seemed to
radiate the glorious halo glow his smile
on the groom and an otherworldly peace
seemed to hang over him brilliant aura
that the voice of the creator of the
heavens and the earth thundered in my
heart remember this Daniel remember what
he looks like this is exactly how the
anti Messiah and his followers will
appear exactly we drove away into that
beautiful winter's day at Dan which we
would later preach and testify to the
lost but I would never forget that first
encounter I ever had with the spirit of
jezebel Young was preparing me preparing
me for the final years on planet earth
teaching me how to ever so clearly
identify how the angel of light would
manifest at the end of the age
you
